section.title: Documentation and information for developers
section.p: Here you find the technical documentation of the Iñupiaq parser. The parser is built in close cooperation with the Sámi language technology project, with a file structure and setup close to the Sámi ones. General documentation can be found at the Sámi project documentation.

section.title: General information for web users
section.p: In order to analyse Iñupiaq text, you may paste in text in the window here. The machine returns text with all possible analyses. The tags are listed below. The parser gives tags for parts of speech, morphosyntactic categories, clitecs, and derivational tags. The derivational affixes have tags carrying the same names as the affixes themselves.
It is also possible to generate wordforms, by pasting the lemma and gramamtical tags here

At present, the parser gives all possible tags, not only the ones appropriate in the given context. We plan making a disambiguator to pick the correct analyses for any given context, but we are not there yet.
The parser uses the following tags:

ul.li:
Morphosyntactic categories
Number:+Sg +Du +Pl
Case:+Abs +Rel +Trm +Abl +Loc +Mod
Mode:+Ind +Int +ConReal -CondUnreal +Cau
Person-number:+1Sg +2Sg +3Sg +4Sg +1Pl +2Pl +3Pl +4Pl +1Du +1SgO +2SgO +3SgO +4SgO +1DuO +2DuO +3DuO +4DuO +1PlO +2PlO+3PlO +4PlO (Objects' persons)
Clitics:+Clt
Other:+Arch
Derivational tags:
+LLATU +LLATU=NIAQ +NIAQ +NIAQ=ŊIT +ŊIT +SAAĠE +SAAĠE=ŊIT +TEQ ! verb elaborating +VIK ! nominalizers +LU +GUUQ +UNA! clitics
